dialogues.text: The land office is in the front of the first floor of the Hollis home, a separate, two-story structure on a side st Now we're looking down the porch as KATE HOLLIS embraces brothers, Emmett and Jake. Her big, bear-like, gentle hus J.T., comes out to add his greetings. After the laying on hands, the attention of all four is drawn to the doorway a figure we cannot yet see. Now he steps shyly into view: eleven-year-old AUGIE. Jake makes a show of shaking Augie's hand, man to man. Emmett  kneels to greet him at eye level; the boy's grown a lot i five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal reaches the top of the hill, a look of high expectati on his face. But now he pulls up sharply, his expression  changing. Not what he expected. Down below in a pretty, little valley that recently embra a farm are hundreds of cattle, roaming free across the la remnants of the fields. And the burnt-out remains of a sm farmhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal dismounts near the blackened timbers and walks into t ruins. He looks around in a daze: he's home, but there's home there.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. KNOLL ABOVE BRADLEY'S PLACE, (HOMESTEADER LAND)
dialogues.text: Paden and Hannah are just reaching the top of the knoll. the distance below them is Bradley's farm, in the barnyar of which the wagon train has pulled up for this first nig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Parker have agreed to  join their parcel to mine. We'll  work them together. (she points) Mine starts right over there. It's  all I've ever wanted. Pretty land,  isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, looking at her) And a pretty lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to face him with a clear-eyed gaze that is almo scary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of men have told me that. Maybe  it's true. I guess some women are  slow to believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're drawn to me by that. But it  never lasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they don't like what I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns back toward  her view) I want to build something, make things  grow. That takes hard work -- a  lifetime of it. That's not why men  come to a pretty woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head, agreeing, though she cannot see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a while, I won't be so pretty.  But this land will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to face him again. He understands now as well a she that romance is not in their future. But friendship c be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah, don't tell me what you think  I want to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah laughs with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal has made a fire in the remains of the fireplace and i cooking food. As he sits back, he senses he is being watc He turns. There at the edge of the light stands an old bl man holding a Henry .44 rifle like Mal's -- his father, E JOHNSON. The two men look at each other a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the light. I thought maybe Rae  had come back to see me. But I never  thought it'd be my boy. I never  thought that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal goes to him and encloses him in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ezra looks up at him and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was sick for a long time. She  was sick when she wrote you, but she  didn't say it. I never thought you'd  come. But she did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal takes it hard. They move back to the fire together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Rae?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone, gone to town. She hated  working on the farm... (a bitter glance) ...just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run me off. They burned me out.  They made it so I couldn't do. Just  like Georgia. If you won't sell,  they take it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as though it were  obvious) The cattle! This valley runs down to  a clear creek. That's why we picked  this spot, and that's why they don't  want us here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You own this land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I paid the government for it, all  right. That don't mean much out here. (he motions behind  him) Malachi, I'm living like a wildcat  in a cave in those hills. Hiding  out, afraid to walk my own land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the law?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose law? The law here runs a man  down -- just like these cattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal thinks about that and grows very angry. Finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't right and I've had enough  of what ain't right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group is finishing dinner in the kitchen/sitting room the back of the ground floor. Augie is tooting the carved whistle pipe that Emmett has given him. Kate and Emmett b to clear the dishes as Jake and J.T. continue to sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought running the land office  would be easy work, J.T., but it  sounds like what you got here ain't  much fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a bad situation here, and  those homesteaders you brought in  with you are going to make it worse. (indicates front of  house) When they come into this office to  stake their claims, I think it's  going to be the start of real trouble.  They're going to cut McKendrick off  on the north.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.T.'s done everything he can. I  married a brave man. Augie, take  that delightful gift your uncle gave  you out of here while we're talking. (back to others) McKendrick picked the new sheriff  himself, so J.T. can't even get the  law enforced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half the gunslingers that drift into  town turn up on our police force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man could die of thirst before  anybody offered him a drink around  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.T. pulls a bottle of whiskey from a cabinet and sets up three glasses, but Kate pantomimes for him to add one for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you all ought to come to  California with Jake and me. (across the room) How 'bout it, Augie, you want to go  with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Augie, there are no schools  in California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aglow) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augie's going to grow up here. There's  nothing wrong with the land, it's  just some of the people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is, Emmett, you killed  the wrong McKendrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, J.T., watch what you're saying  around Augie. Emmett didn't kill  anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Kate, it was self-defense sure  enough, but I think you'd have to  say I killed old Murdo. I think that's  definitely the word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was not -- it was Murdo's. Those  McKendricks don't know how to act  like human beings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His son is worse than he was. He's  smoother, so you don't always hear  him coming, but he'll do anything to  keep his range free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intensely) I'm worried what he's going to do  when he finds out you boys are back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Jake here can take care of  himself. I did five years I didn't  owe. McKendrick ought to be satisfied  with that and let it lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks between her brothers. She is not reassured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having smothered the fire, Mal mounts up, then reaches do to pull his father onto the horse behind him. They begin  picking their way through the cattle when two night-ridin cowboys, RED and SCRUFFY, approach through the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you, Ezra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his mate, jovially) You see pretty good, Red. Is there  one or two of them? (He laughs) What brings you out of your hole,  Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to find that place one  of these days. Who you got with you,  Ezra?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my son. He's come home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't that sweet, Red? I'm afraid  you boys are trespassing on McKendrick  land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it all wrong, mister. This  is our place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Mr. McKendrick bought this  place from your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow we're going to town to  straighten that out once and for  all. The next day we'll be back  here... farming. And these cattle  better be gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cowboys are taken aback. They look to each other guidance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I find any cattle on our land  after tomorrow, I'm going to start  carving them into steaks. And believe  me, that's one thing I know about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killing cattle is a hanging offense  in these parts. If we shot you down  right now, we'd be within our rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister, you ever seen what a Henry  rifle can do in the hands of someone  who knows how to use it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cowboys tense, their gun hands flexing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would that be? You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Mal, Ezra lowers the barrel of his own Henry towar the cowboys and cocks it. He looks like a man coming back life. The two cowboys are dumbfounded. They turn and star to ride away. Scruffy shouts back at them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't the end of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ezra) We're going to get your land back,  Daddy... our land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (marvelling at events) Maybe we will! Maybe we will!  (pause) After all, I never thought I'd get  my son back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden rides along the dark street, drawn irresistibly tow the thinking MUSIC, lights, and hubbub of the big saloon The Midnight Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden comes in and looks around with some pleasure. It's expansive place, busy now with gamblers, drinkers, and  brightly-dressed saloon girls. A piano player bangs away the corner. Paden has to smile. This is the way a saloon  ought to be. Now, even Paden is home. Paden walks up to stand at the bar. The BARTENDER is busy the far end of the bar. Paden is patiently waiting to get his attention when he hears a woman's voice behind him, o his side of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do you for, stranger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden turns to face his interlocutor, but at first cannot find her. After a moment, though, he looks down to see a  small woman in a velvet dress -- STELLA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I run the place. What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is already moving away toward the near end of the bar He watches her disappear around the end, then sees the to of her head appear behind the bar down there. As she move back toward him, she gets taller and taller, until she is facing him eye to eye across the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bourbon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she reaches under the bar and produces bottle and glas Paden leans over and peeks behind the bar. A foot-wide ra runs the length of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) The world is what you make of it,  friend. If it doesn't fit, you make  alterations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drink to that. Will you join  me, Miss --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella sets up a glass for herself, and they shake hands. Paden looks up at a carved ornamental star on the back wa over the words "The Midnight Star".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella... Are you the midnight star  herself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. I'm always there, but I only  shine at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A saloon girl -- a lovely, young, black woman -- RAE pass with some drinks. Paden watches her go, then looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My compliments to you, Miss Stella.  This is what I call a saloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. That's what I call it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know what I'm talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like a good saloon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only place I'm happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. What's wrong with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes meet for a moment, and a real connection is ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't be needing any help  around here, would you? Maybe with  the gambling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points) You see that fellow over there in  the gray coat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden nods, and now we see him too: a big man in some gam like finery -- KELLY. He is leaning over a poker game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Kelly, my so-called partner.  He runs that side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So-called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, aside from being a loud-mouthed,  lying cheat, he's just the man I  would have picked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you go into business with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't own this place. The man who  does stuck me with Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the owner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here he comes right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella nods toward the door, and Paden turns to look. Cob enters through the swinging doors. He looks around with a proprietary air as he walks to the bar. He is almost ther before his gaze settles on Paden and Stella. He stops in tracks, and a big grin splits his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, look at this! Two of my favorite  people in the world, talking to each  other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb moves up and puts an arm around Paden as he shakes h hand. Stella is interested in this connection, but she do faze easily. Paden is the surprised one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella, this is one of my oldest  surviving friends. Treat him right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Oh, yeah, you two are going to get  along fine. You got a lot in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb looks across the room and yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly, get over here. (to Paden) You didn't come all this way just to  pay me back that money, did you? (turns to Kelly) Kelly, meet my friend Paden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool) Howdy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give the man a line of credit. He  already owes the house thirteen bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly casts a wary, appraising glance over Paden, nods, a moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a place to stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got to town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella, we still got an extra room  out back, don't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not in use at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb comes around the end of the bar to stand next to Ste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What brings you into my saloon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luck, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cackles at this) Good old Paden. I was hoping you'd  changed your mind about the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell me you owned a saloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb looks at Paden a long time and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't the half of it, friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away, taking off his coat, and hangs it on a peg back there. When he turns back, rolling up his sleeves, o eyes are drawn to the same thing as Paden's: a shiny, sil sheriff's star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal is asleep on some hay in the small cave his father ha fixed up as a hideout and home. A shadow falls across him Ezra stands looking at his son with loving eyes. In his h are a water bucket and his Henry rifle. Now he turns quie away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ezra emerges. From here, it would be impossible to tell t the cave was inhabited. Except that, on this morning, Mal horse is tied nearby. Ezra looks around cautiously and mo off into the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ezra picks his way among the boulders warily.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOUNTAIN SPRING
dialogues.text: Ezra comes out of the surrounding rocks and goes to the e of the spring. A stream runs off downhill from the pool. props the rifle against a rock and bends to drink from th spring. He hears something and turns quickly. What he see makes him reach for the rifle, but the sound of several G COCKING freezes him inches from it. There are four Cowboys, McKendrick's men, emerging from t hiding places. Their eyes search the surrounding rocks.  Scruffy and Red, the cowboys from the previous night, are there, but the leader is HOYT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the other one, Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ezra is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't leave well enough alone,  could you, old man? (resigned) Our orders are to run you two off.  If you tell us where your son is, we  won't have to do any shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying, Hoyt... like always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this time. I got my orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ezra thinks a moment, looks over at Scruffy, then back to Hoyt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son's on his way to town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad. You'll have to go by  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The distant ROAR OF GUNS echoes in the small space. Mal a with a start. Did he dream it? He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal, rifle in hand and frantic, is lost among the rocks. he stops, listening. He hears HOOFBEATS. He scrambles to top of a boulder and looks down. WHAT HE SEES. The four Cowboys far below are riding away  from the base of the hill.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MOUNTAIN SPRING
dialogues.text: Mal comes out of the rocks. Ezra's rifle is no longer pro where he left it. Ezra is gone. Mal rushes to the edge of the spring, in agony. He looks around desperately, and th freezes. Ezra's dead body is floating away down the mountain strea Mal splashes into the water, tripping and sliding on the  slippery rocks. Finally, he is able to reach Ezra. Mal si in the water and hugs his father to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a few customers. Early light streams in over gamblin tables draped with dust covers. Stella is busy behind the bar. Paden and Emmett are nursing cups of coffee at a tab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah's a smart, pretty woman, but  she's got a hard idea for living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't follow) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is, you won't trip  over me if you look her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understands, but --) I'm going to California with my  brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb comes in the swinging doors, heading for the bar. Pa waves him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, I want you to meet Emmett.  He's a friend of mine. (to Emmett) This is Sheriff Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking hands) Pleased to meet you, Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interested) Pleasure is mine. Always happy to  meet a friend of Paden's. (yelling to Stella) Stella, bring Kelly out here, will  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb turns back to Emmett with an odd smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Kate Hollis' brother, aren't  you? (Emmett nods) You're the one who killed old Murdo  McKendrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden watches as the two men let that hang between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't have much choice. He was about  to shoot my brother in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't be having that now can we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella appears with Kelly, who speaks to Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to make some adjustments.  I wanted you to be here when I offered  Paden your job. I think he could do  it without getting greedy. Stella  and I are tired of you skimming our  profits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella is surprised. The charge is true, but she didn't k this was coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done talking. Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning Cobb hits Kelly viciously in the stomach. Stella jumps. Cobb grabs the doubled-over Kelly by the ha and the belt, and propels him out of the saloon, letting before Kelly crashes through the swinging doors and into street. Cobb comes back toward the table as though nothin had happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about it, Paden? You want the  job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden, considering, glances at the still swinging doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you're an understanding boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb chuckles, picks up Paden's coffee cup, and takes a s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing like that will happen between  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we ought to ask Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns toward her. She likes the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is smiling at him warmly when suddenly her eyes shift her expression changes, and she screams --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Kelly! He'll kill you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb is already in motion. He spins, drawing his gun, and fires repeatedly at the swinging doors. Kelly has been ai over them and is blasted back into the street as the slat splinter. Cobb holsters his gun. The coffee cup is still his other hand. He takes a final sip, puts the cup down, licks a spilled drop off his thumb. Stella is repulsed. Cobb fixes her with a malevolent look and his tone is icy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for warning me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella rushes out to the street, as Emmett and Paden get Emmett and Cobb are very close for one moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't have much choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go out through the gathering crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the street a stagecoach is rolling into town. Cobb s off the porch to kneel beside Kelly's body. He looks acro at the already-kneeling Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never enjoy killing a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella stands, so for a moment she is taller than he. She stalks back into the saloon. The stagecoach has pulled up across the street. A tall, l gambler has disembarked and now walks toward the saloon,  carrying his heavy satchel. He moves through the assemble people until he is standing over Kelly's body. This is SL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Sheriff. I'm a gambler  who would like to run an honest game  in your town. To whom do I speak  about that? (glances down) I hope it's not this gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb likes his style. He smiles and turns to indicate Pad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden and Cobb exchange looks for a second. Then Cobb is  bustling off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get somebody to clean up  this mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett and Paden watch Cobb move down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used to ride with that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden looks at Emmett, then down at Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake unhitches the pinto and begins to lead it away. Sudd Augie appears from nowhere on the back porch, jumps up to the railing, and leaps out toward the pinto's back -- jus as Jake did in the escape from Turley. But Augie misses a lands in the dirt. Jake, irritated, watches the child dus himself off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing? I told you to  practice with a horse that's not  moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake turns and starts away. Augie runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got things to do, kid. I'm a busy  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops, looks at him) A grown man can't have a little boy  with him everywhere he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake walks away. Augie watches, then yells --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's a grown man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella works at the spigots of some large kegs, filling e bottles with a portion of whiskey, diluting them with wat and corking them. Paden comes in and watches her. She han him a bottle to cork and starts the process again as he s it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a fair mix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saving lives here. The straight  stuff would raise a blood blister on  boot leather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant, seemed like a lot of whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a smile. Paden takes down a fancier bottle fro shelf, examining the label.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the good stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? How good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She understands him and produces two glasses with a grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pouring the drinks) Here's to the good stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella lifts her glass, sealing the bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May it last a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before they can drink, the Bartender bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is crowded but silent, frozen. Near the middle o the bar the sexy, young, saloon girl, PHOEBE, stands  frightened between Jake and Tyree, the mean fellow we saw released at Chimayo -- now a deputy for Sheriff Cobb. The two men appear about to draw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened, Tyree. This is my  job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe a lady has to explain  anything to a man this ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick watches from a card table nearby, with Rae standing beside him. Now his hand drops casually from the curve of her rear to the vicinity of his boot. Paden and Stella come up on opposite sides of the bar, hi in front. Paden sees everything in the room: Tyree's frie Deputies Kyle and GARTH, are behind Jake and clearly pois to kill him if Tyree fails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with venom) Stay out of it, Paden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't do that, Tyree. Cobb's hired  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Cobb's mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come out of there, Phoebe. You've  done enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Phoebe starts to move from between the men, Tyree grab her viciously by the arm. In the instant of that movement Paden's hand flashes out and draws Tyree's Colt out of it holster from behind. Garth and Kyle tense as Tyree whirls Paden, eyes flaming. But his own gun is pointed at his ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I did was kiss the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you said in Turley. You  remember how that ended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Paden? You afraid  I couldn't get those two behind me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you getting anyone in  my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks at Paden, who motions him out with the gun. Ja starts to move grudgingly, but first flashes Phoebe a big "see you later" look. He goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paden) I should have killed you a long time  ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden flips the gun in his grasp and hands it to Tyree, b first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The situation is now totally reversed, and no one can qui believe it. Tyree cocks the gun. At the poker table Slick lifts his pant leg, revealing the handle of a custom-made dagger secreted in his boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, Tyree. I just lost a  partner. If you kill him, I'll never  get anyone to work here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyree considers for a moment, then holsters his gun. To S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better start looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes out. Garth and Kyle follow. Phoebe hurries away f Stella's hard look. Slick relaxes. The piano kicks in. Pa leans against the bar toward Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really are a gambler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me some of the good stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens on the upstairs porch and Rae emerges, giggl and buttoning her dress. A hand reaches out and pulls her back inside for another squealing embrace. She pushes her free and comes outside again, then starts down the exteri stairs. She is almost to the bottom when she stops sudden Mal stands at the bottom of the stairs. They look at each other a long time. Conflicting emotions race across Rae's face, but the winner is cold anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Rae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? I thought  you were done with our family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae seems to sway, then sits down on the stairs above Mal For a moment she is somewhere else, but when she returns, her look is as hard as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure, but I got an idea. And  when I am sure, they're going to  pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter) Oh that's just fine. Where were you  when Ma and Daddy needed you? It's  too late, Mal. Now you finally show  up and all you can think of is to  get yourself killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Slick comes down the stairs behind Rae, pulling on hi jacket. Mal glares at him; this is who can buy his sister now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Rae?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick seems unperturbed by Mal's glare. To Rae --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you introduce me to your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not my friend. He used to be my  brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offers his hand to  Mal) Calvin Stanhope... but my mother  called me Slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal just looks at the proffered hand. Slick retracts it  without offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking, mister,  but I think Rae's a special lady.  Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick comes down past Mal and moves off. Mal watches him then turns to Rae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here, Rae? This  ain't for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae, all we got is each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing up) I don't have any family any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brushes past him and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BRADLEY'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Carol, Bradley's daughter, and a Friend are playing on th roof of the farmhouse, above the noisy activity of the  welcoming celebration. Now Bradley steps into the foregro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fall off of there, you fools!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might do them some good, Daniel. I  wasn't worth a damn until I fell off  the barn on my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men turn to look at the dancing. It's a festive s all around: tables are laden with food near a large bonfi a few of the covered wagons are pulled up nearby, childre dart about before the pick-up band of musicians. Now we see, here among the sodbusters, whirling by with a comely lass, Jake, looking mighty slim without his double gunbelt. He and his partner glide by Emmett, who stands  shouting over the din with Hannah and Mr. and MRS. PARKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah's the hardest-working gal I  ever saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you the best, Mrs. Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Parker twirls his wife off into the dance. Emmett and Hannah, a slightly awkward couple, stroll away from the m This is the first time Emmett has seemed less than certai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Parkers seem like nice folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've been kind to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a few steps) Paden sends his best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I guess I put a good scare into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett smiles in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised to see you out here  tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came out to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopped) Goodbye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me and Jake will be heading  out for California soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hannah is silent for a moment. She sits down at one of th tables and looks at him. For the first time there is a  softness in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came all the way out here to  tell me you're going to California?  All you had to do was go, and we'd  never see each other again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him an odd look, a soft challenge to his retice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down beside her and looks at his boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't make it easy on a fellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't Paden tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett smiles at that and looks into her lovely eyes. Aft a long moment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you thought you'd be back this  way someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... that must have been it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP ON THE ROOF of the farmhouse, Carol is yelling and  gesturing to her oblivious father below, while her Friend stares frozen into the night. Jake is wiping his brow as he stands at the edge of the  dancers. He looks up at Carol quizzically. Only now do we hear it, over the din of the music: the TH of hooves. Out of the night, streaming around the farm  buildings, comes a horde of masked Cowboys, McKendrick's  men. They send up a horrible yell and begin firing their  weapons in the air. Their arrival is so sudden that the celebrants are frozen their places, mothers hugging children to them, men far f their weapons. There are SCREAMS. Emmett grabs a panicked child from the path of the horses and moves back, passing her to Hannah. He's trying to gau his response in the midst of all these innocents. Two Cowboys have roped opposite ends of a section of fenc and now pull the deadly drag, already thick with ravaged  corn, through the barnyard, knocking over everything in i path. Jake slides through the chaos toward his gunbelt, hung on peg on the barn wall. A Cowboy pulls the gate from the pigsty, and the pigs squ out. Another Cowboy begins shooting them with a Henry rif On the roof, Carol looks in horror at the death of her pr sow. Emmett is herding as many Settlers as he can toward the c of the barn. Bradley edges toward the door of his farmhouse. Hobart is urging some women between two wagons. A Cowboy  rides by and kicks him viciously. Hoyt pulls up, looks around, then gestures to some of his men. Two Cowboys with prepared torches in their hands rid up to the bonfire and swing low, lighting their firebrand One moves ahead toward the farmhouse, reins his horse, an heaves the torch high in the air toward the roof on which the two children perch. In the air, the tumbling flame suddenly explodes at the R of a shotgun. Sparks shower harmlessly to the ground. Bradley has shot it out of the air with one barrel of his shotgun. The blast has created a momentary, shocked lull the attack. Bradley looks wild. Emmett watches, fearful. His hand is on his gun. Hoyt looks at Bradley. Bradley swings the shotgun around  toward the other torch-bearer. The Cowboy who tossed the first torch shoots Bradley dead Carol screams. Emmett looks across the yard at Jake, who steps out from cowering homesteaders, a gun in each hand. Emmett draws a kills the man who shot Bradley. Now all the Settlers hit dirt. Jake fires from both hands repeatedly. One Cowboy dies an another takes it in the arm. The man who was shooting the pigs swings his rifle around toward Jake, and Emmett kill him with one shot. Hoyt reacts big to the presence of deadly wolves in the m of these sheep. He peers through the tumult, trying to se their faces. His Cowboys are shooting wildly into the cro now, but he rides through them, signalling a retreat. Emmett jumps from the top of a fence to the roof of the h the Henry rifle in his hand. He scrambles to the peak of roof, where the two children still cower. Bracing the rif on the chimney, he takes careful aim. Once... twice... he fires. One Cowboy dead, one wounded and fleeing. Hannah runs up to the riderless horse of a fallen Cowboy pulls a rifle from its scabbard. She cocks it and fires o at the retreating Cowboys. Jake mounts a horse Pony Expre style and rides out of the barnyard.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BRADLEY'S PLACE
dialogues.text: LATER. Emmett lowers a weeping Carol to the ground. The g rushes toward her fallen father and her mother, who cradl the body. Hobart intercepts the girl, trying to shield he from the sight. Emmett's eyes meet Hobart's. Hobart lets  Carol go. Emmett walks through the devastation to where Hannah stan dazed, rifle still in hand. Emmett puts his arm around he She jumps at his touch, then moves against him. Jake ride into the barnyard and up to Emmett. He is flushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's two more out there walking  home, if they can walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett's gaze is caught by something across the barnyard. Hannah follows his gaze. Mr. Parker stumbles out of the darkness at the side of th barn, sobbing. Hannah breaks from Emmett and rushes to Mr Parker. When she is beside him, she freezes, staring into the shadows. Emmett watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augie is standing circus-style on the saddle of the pinto he rides down the alley. As he approaches the main street his foot slips, and he bumps down hard into the saddle. T horse is barely in his control as he bounces out into the busier thoroughfare, and into the path of -- An imposing  phalanx of four horsemen: Hoyt, Scruffy, SWANN, and their boss, ETHAN MCKENDRICK. The pinto shies as the horsemen p up abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry 'bout that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swann looks with interest at the pinto, then reaches out grabs the reins from Augie's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get this horse, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my uncle's horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritable) What's the problem, Swann?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett steps off the sidewalk on the other side of the st and approaches the group, his eyes on McKendrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick turns at the sound of Emmett's voice. Somethin powerful flicks through his eyes, but not too many people would see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoyt eyes Emmett, who seems familiar. Emmett looks at Swa in such a way that Swann releases the reins of the pinto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it seem short to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick reacts to Emmett's tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all over as far as I'm  concerned, Emmett. I'm satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right then. (to his men) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McKendrick, don't you recognize  that pinto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Lee's horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Swann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now McKendrick understands. He avoids Emmett's gaze and s to Swann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Get down off of there,  Augie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augie hops down as Emmett takes the reins. Emmett gives A a look and a small nod, and the boy steps away. Emmett looks once again at the distinctive brand on the  pinto's flank, a circle with two wavy lines beneath it. N he leads the pinto around beside McKendrick's horse so he can see the brand on that animal. McKendrick has to twist his saddle to watch Emmett. The brands are the same. Emme looks up at McKendrick. Things are clear between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man who lost this horse must  have been working for you. I should  have known. But you changed your  brand, Ethan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick's tone is different now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of things changed when my father  died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett lays the reins of the pinto across the front of  McKendrick's saddle, but they might just as well be a  gauntlet. McKendrick picks them up. He and his men move d the street. Emmett walks over and takes Augie beneath his arm. DOWN THE STREET. Hoyt rides close to McKendrick but looks back over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McKendrick, he was one of them  last night at Bradley's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick reacts: more bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.T. supervises the newly-arrived Settlers as they file t homestead claims. There is a battle-weary but resolved ai to the group after the night attack. They are going to st it out. The last step in the filing process is to sign in large register. Mr. Parker signs and moves away. Hannah s up for her turn. Her face is a little harder today, but h hand is steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of the Settlers' wagons are here, guarded by vigi armed men. Their attitude has become more wary, siege-lik Parker climbs onto a wagon. Hannah is about to follow whe Emmett approaches with Augie, who runs off around the hou Several of the Settlers greet Emmett warmly. Emmett looks closely at Hannah's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a brutal land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have known that before you  came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's one thing to know it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks off, then bitterly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We told Sheriff Cobb about the attack. (with an edge) He said he'd... look into it. (Emmett understands) I can't believe he's the law out  here. Now I see why you all wear  guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Mr. Parker doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like you'd think. But he's not  going to run. We're sticking to our  plan. Now we both need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett looks her over. He's not liking her any less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb sits with his boots up on his desk. McKendrick sits the shadows across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's good, all right. Too good for  my men. That's why you've got to  take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about his brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll handle that. He's careless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are getting messy around here. (he looks at McKendrick) I hear Ezra Johnson got himself  killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear his son is still around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick reacts to that, and Cobb can't suppress a smil McKendrick sees it and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, looks like you're finally going  to earn your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella and Cobb have been dividing the receipts between t Cobb puts another sum in a leather pouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll be for Paden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella is impressed by the amount. Cobb notes her reactio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an advance. We want him to know  he's going to be happy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't worry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you two would get along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb opens the office door and holds it for Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb and Stella come out into the saloon, which is not ye crowded. Stella moves up her ramp behind the bar as Cobb  walks along in front of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what I've seen, Paden doesn't  care much about money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he doesn't care about  anything, but he does. There's just  no telling what it's going to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick is standing at the bar. Cobb settles in next to him They nod at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy, Mr. Slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb turns to Stella, who has put a bottle before him and pouring Cobb and herself drinks. Cobb seems to be includi Slick in the following story, though he addresses Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you about your friend  Paden. Me and him and Tyree and a  few other boys did a good bit of  riding together a few years back.  Business, you know, and business was  pretty good. We were moving around a  lot, the way you have to in that  work, and somewhere along the line  we picked up this dog. One of the  boys took to feeding it, so it  followed us everywhere. Anyway, this  one time we were leaving a little  Missouri town in quite a hurry, with  a bunch of the locals on our tails.  The dog somehow got tangled up with  Tyree's horse and Tyree went flying.  Tyree was pretty mad when he jumped  up, so he shot the dog. Didn't kill  him, though. Before you know it,  Paden's off his horse and holding  the dog. He'd gone all strange on  us. Said we should go on without  him. I thought he was kidding at  first. But he wasn't. Tyree was ready  to plug 'em both. And all this with  the posse coming down on us. Here I  thought we were pals after all that  riding. And suddenly he's more worried  about a mutt. So we did like he asked  and left him. He went to jail for a  dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella has been listening intently. Now her glance shifts Paden has walked up beside Cobb. Cobb lifts his glass to  Paden with a grin, but speaks to Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you want to hear the funny part?  Paden didn't even like the damn dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden gives Cobb an odd glance but smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It evened out in the end. They locked  me up, but the dog sprung me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb and Slick laugh, but Stella just watches Paden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the dog now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb takes the bottle and a couple glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Paden, I'll buy you a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb leads Paden to a table in the corner. As Paden sits  down, Cobb drops the pouch on the table. Paden glances at the contents as Cobb pours the drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took out thirteen dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a lot of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you this was a sweet set-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you could run it without Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden looks sharply at Cobb. With some heat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is her life. I'll go before she  does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb is amused but not surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, boy. Just an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks, but forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Paden, what makes all this  work is me doing my job. The fellows  you came to town with are causing  some trouble. It's going to take a  little straightening out. I have my  responsibilities. I want you to  understand. It has nothing to do  with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden looks at Cobb a long time, then at his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Do nothing. Don't get between  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a great believer in doing nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we understand each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me. If you're taking  on Emmett, the last place I want to  be is between you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move along the burnished barrel of the old Henry .44 r to Emmett's eye, sighting along its length. Now we see his target. In the distance is a small cactus  plant. Emmett squeezes off a shot. The cactus does not mo He aims again and fires quickly. Again, nothing at the ca AT THE CACTUS. Now we're right behind the target plant, E in the distance. When he fires, a thin needle at the top  edge of the plant is blown away, the bullet leaving a sha trough in the green skin. He fires again, and the next ne disappears. Now there are four troughs. He's been hitting from the start. Emmett lowers the rifle, walks back to his horse tied nea and leaves the rifle, then moves away from the horse agai He stops, looking at a can in the dust fifty feet away. H shakes the fingers of his gun hand once, then very quickl he draws his Colt and fires. The can jumps into the air.  While it is still moving, Emmett holsters the gun, releas it, then draws again and fires. As the can jumps once mor Emmett repeats the action. Six times he draws. The can do stop moving until after the last shot. The horrible NOISE echoes away as Emmett holds the empty before him. From behind a rock ahead of him, Deputy Garth appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're empty, mister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett immediately begins to bolt toward his horse. A las settles around his arms and whips him viciously backwards In a second he is back on his feet and running like a bul toward Deputy Kyle, who has stepped from the brush to thr the rope. Immediately a second lasso catches Emmett from other side and pulls taut. A deputy on horseback, CHARLIE has roped him. Charlie and Kyle pull their ropes, yanking Emmett onto his back. Now appearing around a bend in the arroyo is Tyree, a nas glint in his eye. He rides hard directly toward Emmett. E watches the pounding hooves approach. He struggles but ca move. Tyree's horse thunders over him, one hoof catching side with a sickening THUD. Emmett writhes in agony. Tyree turns his horse and heads back. Kyle pulls harder o his rope. Tyree rides over Emmett again, but we can't see the damage for the dust. Tyree walks his horse over and l down, as Garth, Kyle, and Charlie converge. Emmett's head is bleeding, his body crumpled. But he look up at them through pain-squinted eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't you dead yet, mister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb said he'd be hard to kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Emmett) Guess you couldn't hear us coming. (to the others) He was practicing so hard for a fight,  he missed the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others cackle. Garth draws his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to lower the muzzle toward Emmett. There is the echoing CRACK of a shot and the gun flies from Garth's  shattered hand. Mal stands on a rock above them, his rifle pointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to kill you, and you  don't want to be dead. Drop your  guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other deputies exchange glances as Garth bends in pai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't be that good, Tyree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dropping his rope) I think we should do like he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the others start to unbuckle their holsters, Charlie, compliant one, draws on Mal. Mal shoots him out of the sa dead. The others freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal comes into view, leading a motley remuda. Emmett is t onto his horse, unconscious. The four deputies' riderless horses are strung along behind. All their guns have been  tied on Emmett's horse. Now Mal releases the extra horses and shoos them away. He leads Emmett's horse up the trail into the hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett and Mal's horses are tied near the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal has tended to Emmett's head wound and now binds a lar ugly bruise on his ribs. Emmett, half-conscious, writhes pain, and now his eyes flicker open. Confused, he makes a futile attempt to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Gotta go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett passes out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three surviving deputies, gunless, trudge along the r Garth holds his wounded hand close to his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett lies sleeping in the flickering light of the fire. Mal sits nearby, his Henry rifle lying at his feet. He is examining the Henry that Emmett had at the arroyo. Emmett wakes up, wincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someplace safe. How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett's look makes it clear -- "bad".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be worse if you hadn't come along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't just come along. I was  looking for you. (Emmett doesn't  understand) Jake said you were out there. I saw  him in town, and he told me about  that business the other night. Said  you boys took a Henry off one of  McKendrick's men. I wanted to see  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal looks at the rifle in his arms sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was my father's. The men who  killed him took it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at him a moment) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett tries to move his pain-racked body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get to my brother. If they  came after me, they'll want him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still trying) Have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal reaches out with a strong hand and eases Emmett back  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go. I'll bring Jake out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a long look) Be careful. You're in it now. And  it's gonna get mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far that's all I seen in this  life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet here, nobody around. We move up to the hay-loa window at the loft level. Now Jake dives into view, leapi from the hayloft to a beam and flipping completely around it. We hear GIGGLES. Phoebe climbs the ladder onto the lo and looks in wonder at her manic companion, who now flies back onto the loft. They look at each other with hungry  anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal, on foot, makes his way cautiously through the gloom the end of the alley. He looks over at the Hollis home an land office, windows aglow. Now Mal spots a Cowboy down t street smoking a cigarette as he leans against a hitching post. Mal is peering at him uncertainly when the front do of the Hollis house opens, and Kate steps out onto the po The Cowboy steps quickly back into the shadows, and Mal n it. Kate vigorously shakes a tablecloth over the railing and  turns back inside, talking as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augie, I've had enough of this. Kiss  your father and get in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door behind her. Mal sees the cowboy calle Red coming down the street and hurries away in the direct he came from. Red comes up to the WATCHING COWBOY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of him yet? ("no") He ain't at the saloon either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is that boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is finishing her evening's makeup in the cracked mirr of her cramped, little room. Mal slides in the door behin her, closing it quickly. He carries his rifle. She sees h reflection and stiffens but continues making up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. We have nothing to talk  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae, I need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why come to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're my sister. There's  nobody else. (a beat) The men who killed Daddy are after  Jake. I gotta talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's stopping you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're watching the Hollis place. I  can't get through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think I could?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they stop you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter irony) Because I'm your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal sits down on her bed. She looks at him a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella is working behind the bar. Slick is playing poker a table nearby. Now Rae appears and whispers in his ear. throws in his cards, gets up, and follows her toward the  stairs. Stella watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal looks up as the door opens, then stands up when he se that Rae has brought Slick with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. You need help, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking up at the church steeple from across the  square. Now Slick steps into the foreground, looks around and waves someone on from behind. Mal comes into the fram

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Jake said he'd meet you behind the  church. Be careful. They're all over  the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal's opinion of Slick has softened. He offers his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes hands) Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal looks around, then slips away toward the church. Slic stands and watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal comes around the corner of the building. Cobb is loun comfortably on the back steps. Mal aims his rifle, but Co doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Ezra Johnson's boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal cocks the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot the sheriff. It's against  the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three deputies appear quietly out of the shadows behind M their guns pointed. The door behind Cobb opens, revealing Garth, his hand bandaged. Mal lowers the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's killing a deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyree comes up behind Mal and takes the rifle from his ha Suddenly he hits him in the kidney with the rifle butt. M goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to give you a fair  trial...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth has come down the steps and over to Mal. He holds h bandaged hand out in front of him, then kicks Mal vicious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...followed by a first-class hanging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally Cobb gets up and walks over to look down at Mal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or you can ride out of here before  dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal turns his head so he can look up at Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you gotta do is tell me where to  find your friend Emmett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is serving drinks at a table in the noisy saloon. She sees Slick come in. Their eyes meet, but he goes to the b and orders a drink. She hurries over there. Slick throws  back a shot and turns to her, upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did your brother tell you he killed  a deputy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake never showed up. Sheriff Cobb  arrested Mal. Took him off to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae begins to crack. Slick takes her into his arms. Stell moves up behind the bar, looking closely at Rae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here, Rae?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Mal as he dabs at a split lip with the tail of h shirt. He's sitting on a cot in a cell. He has been beate more. As the door to the outer office clangs open, he rea with resignation; here comes more pain. But when he looks up, it is Paden standing outside the bars. Behind Paden,  Garth throws a hostile look at Mal and goes out. Paden no Mal's condition. Mal regards Paden coolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are they doing this, Mal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they enjoy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard from Stella you were trying  to find Jake. What happened to Emmett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden takes the rebuke and shakes his head "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb's men just about killed him.  That's what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got there just short of too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pained) Lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal snorts derisively at that and glances around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's working out real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Emmett now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal gives him a disbelieving look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're working for Cobb these days,  aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden grimly acknowledges that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friends have been beating me to  find that out. You think I'm gonna  just tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal gets up to face Paden, separated by only a few inches and the steel bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You waltzed in here pretty easy, and  you can go out the same way. (motions him away) Me they're figuring to carry out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden knows that no explanation will suffice here. Sadly, turns away from his former riding companion and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae waits nervously behind the noisy saloon, peering into the darkness. Now she sees what she's been waiting for: P comes out of the shadows. His mind elsewhere, it takes hi moment to focus on Rae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considers a moment) It looks bad, Rae. He's a hard man,  and he won't give them what they  want. It's gonna cost him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you stop them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae begins to cry quietly and leans against a wall. Phoeb appears from the other direction and goes up to Rae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae? It's Phoebe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake has put his horse in the little corral behind the Ho house. He whistles as he goes up onto the back porch and the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one, dim lamp burning in the room. Jake sails hi hat across the room onto a hook, picks up a match, and li a second lamp. He calls out softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the lamp and moves toward the dark office at front of the house and the stairs which lead upstairs. He steps through the door and freezes. A cocked six-gun appe near his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the light of Jake's lamp he sees: four masked men have Kate, J.T., and Augie gagged and held at gunpoint. The li boy is in his nightshirt. For one long moment Jake seems be considering a play. McKendrick is the one with the gun Jake's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae has been tearfully telling Phoebe her story as Paden  stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for Jake? Jake's been with  me all evening. I just left him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly alert) Where is he now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden takes off running into the darkness. Phoebe looks a him, confused. Rae grabs her by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All evening? Even after Slick came?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae begins to understand an awful truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A masked man (Hoyt) steadies Jake, hands bound behind his back, on one of the horses Red and the Watching Cowboy ha brought up to the front of the house. Another of the men  (Scruffy) is just coming out onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside only two masked men remain, McKendrick and Swann.  J.T. watches them with hostile eyes. Swann notices Kate  peering out the window at Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a long look, lady. It's the  last you'll see of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick has been looking thoughtfully at the ledgers a records shelved around the land office. Now he picks up t lamp Jake brought into the room. It lights his eyes above the bandana mask. They lock with J.T.'s . McKendrick heav the lamp into the shelves. Kerosene flames engulf the led McKendrick starts to move toward the door. J.T. snaps. He picks up a heavy register book and hurtles with enormous force, hitting McKendrick in the back of th head and knocking him down. J.T. dives for McKendrick's g Kate watches in terror, then sees Swann point his gun at scrambling J.T. She grabs Swann's arm, and his gun fires  into the floor. J.T. comes up with McKendrick's gun and fires quickly at  Swann, who has thrown off Kate. Swann, hit in the shoulde crashes back through a window and out onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake reacts in anguish and twists in his saddle. Hoyt poi a cocked gun at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scruffy, back at the door now, fires twice into J.T., sla his big body backward against the base of a counter. Kate's scream is muffled by her gag. Augie, eyes wide, da to his father's body, but rather than embrace him, he pri the gun from J.T.'s fingers and raises it toward Scruffy. Kate sees what's happening and leaps at Scruffy. He vicio pistol-whips her. Her unconscious, falling body knocks th gun from Augie's hand. McKendrick is straightening now, his head clearing. His  bandana has fallen from his face. He looks in horror at t wounded Hollises. Augie stares at his revealed face. Scruffy's gun is cocked and pointed at Augie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick hates the way it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden runs up. Down the street in front of the Hollis hou a mass of men and horses, lit by the growing flames, thun away into the night. Paden races toward the house, as  neighbors rush about raising the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden runs up to the open front door and is momentarily  stopped by the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In among the flames a bleeding Kate is desperately trying drag J.T.'s inert bulk to the door. Paden reaches her, pi her up, and runs out. Two neighbors pass him on their way J.T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chaotic scene as the fire-fighting is organized. Severa Neighbor Women help Paden ease Kate down on a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help J.T.!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Augie? (to Paden) Her boy must be upstairs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden rises as if to go back in, but stops at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... they took him. They took  my Augie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden reacts to this, then turns as the two neighbors lay J.T.'s body nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word of the fire has not reached here, and normal, noisy  activity reigns. Slick is dealing a three-man poker game. Rae watches him from across the room, then takes a drink  over to him. When she places it before him, he looks up  appreciatively, then goes back to his game. She puts her  arms around him from behind and kisses his neck, then sli sensuously into the empty seat beside him. He ignores her adoring look and roaming hands, but smiles as he plays. BENEATH THE TABLE. Rae's left hand roves excitingly high Slick's thigh. Now, so smooth and quick we barely see it, her right hand lifts his trouser leg and slips the custom made dagger from his boot. Slick deals a hand. Rae watches him thoughtfully. The swi doors behind them crash open, and a TOWNSMAN bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire! The land office is on fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the patrons rush out, including the players in Sl game, who grab their chips first. Slick peeks at one of t thrown-down hands out of curiosity, then rises slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we take a look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae nods, and when she rises to take his arm, her hands a empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The townspeople have formed a bucket brigade in a losing  battle with the fire at the Hollis house. SHOUTS fill the air above the ROAR of the inferno. Stella is among the new arrivals from the saloon. She is  stopped by the sight of Kate, bloody and hysterical, bein borne away. Horrified by the scene, Stella now snaps out it and begins YELLING ORDERS to the saloon patrons to hel fight the blaze. Paden is only a few feet from the flames, at the head of bucket line. He is in shirt sleeves, sweaty and sooty. Th heat of the fire is driving the line back. The Townsman n to Paden yells to him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way! It's a goner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, Tyree, and Kyle appear from the shadows. Cobb takes the scene and spots J.T. being carried across the street. motions Tyree over to investigate, then moves toward the  fire. Slick and Rae arrive within the light of the blaze. Slick watches with detached interest, but Rae's gaze quickly lo on Cobb moving through the chaos. She sees him now with n eyes. Phoebe, crying, watches as J.T.'s limp body is hurried of on a stretcher, DR. SKINNER in attendance. She turns and face to face with Tyree, who grasps her arms. She regards him with revulsion and fear, then breaks from him and run off. Cobb moves up next to Paden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden glances at him, then throws more water on. But now bucket line slows to a halt. The townspeople fade back a  little to watch the inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
