dialogues.text: I hate to see this kind of thing in  my town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden glares at Cobb, who is watching the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to look into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe I will too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at him) I thought we talked about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't talk about this. (a beat, indignant) They took the little boy, Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden moves off toward a nearby hitching post, where he h left his gunbelt and hat. Cobb looks after him a moment,  then follows. They are now a short distance from the  onlookers. Paden straps on his gunbelt, but his eyes are Cobb as he approaches, silhouetted against the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still worried about the dog,  aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden ties his holster to his thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta calm down, Paden. Everything  will be put straight in a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw how you're putting Mal Johnson  straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something flicks through Cobb's eyes. He turns slowly and looks at the scene behind him. At the edge of the crowd a tired Stella sits on an overturned bucket, watching the f she wipes her sweaty brow with the sleeve of her dress. S looking that way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never could count on you to be  reasonable. (turns back to Paden) Don't force me to make an adjustment  around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, you've got nothing I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not thinking about your future,  Paden. I'm worried about Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she got to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a thing. She's just a mutual  friend. (a beat) But if you wind up on the wrong side  of this, she's going to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden stares at Cobb, but now his eyes follow Cobb's righ hand, which swings up to Paden's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to save you from  yourself. Don't change your luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb lets his hand drop and begins to move away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some sleep, Paden. Things'll  look better tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden watches as Cobb walks over to Stella. Cobb takes a  handkerchief from his pocket and squats before Stella. He starts to wipe her forehead solicitously, but she takes t handkerchief from his hand. Cobb looks back at Paden as h rises and moves off. Paden turns and looks into the leaping flames. Our eyes c barely discern the change as these flames dissolve into  others, the fire now in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The low fire illuminates Emmett, who is sitting on the ha He is sweating badly and seems to be concentrating on som rigorous task. Now we see what it is -- to stand up. He  struggles to his feet, wincing in pain, his hand steadyin against the rock. When he is upright, he tries to clear h head and finally lets go of the wall. For a moment he see all right. Then, suddenly, he drops heavily back to the f The fall sends more pain shooting through his ribs. He's  going nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Middle of the night. All is quiet, no one on the street. watches from the shadows across the street as DEPUTY FOX  leaves the jail and moves away. Rae goes toward the jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is nearly deserted. Paden sits alone at a table killing a bottle of the good stuff. Stella watches him po another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you drink any faster? We need  the bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden throws her a look as she takes one of the empty cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it that I can't figure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb's got something on you, and it  must be pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden is impressed, even at this late date, by her acuity

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he didn't you'd never sit still  while this was happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? Maybe that's the kind of  friend I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs derisively) Nah! (moving on) What's he got? This is a nice saloon,  but there are other nice saloons.  It's not the money. Not for you. Why  can't I get ahold of it? (watches him take a  drink) Cobb says there's no telling what  you're going to care about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly amused) Is that what he said? Well, he figured  it okay this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She regards him as he looks at his glass. Then he looks u and for one moment their eyes meet. Paden, uncomfortable, quickly looks away. In that second, she understands her o role in this. And she is deeply moved. They are silent  together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal looks up as the door to the outer office clangs open. Deputy Garth comes in with Rae in tow. Mal comes to the f of his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's here, Johnson, it's your  sweet little sister. You remember  her, works at The Midnight Star.  Everybody knows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal and Rae look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wanted to see you. Course I had  to search her. I'm not sure I did a  good job. Might have missed something. (holds up his bandaged  hand) Only got one good hand, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae steps toward Mal, but Garth suddenly grabs her arm an flings her back against the wall opposite Mal's cell. He  moves close to Rae and slips the big ring of keys over hi bandaged right hand, freeing his left. He looks once at M then down Rae's body. His left hand fondles her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I better check her a little  closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal's eyes flame as Garth takes Rae in a lascivious embra Suddenly Rae dips to one side within his arms. Her hand c up from her boot with Slick's dagger and plunges it into  Garth's back. The deputy jolts back a few steps in shock, already pulling a six-gun from his belt with his left han He fires once into Rae's body. She goes down. Garth is cocking the gun again with weakening fingers whe Mal's hand encircles his neck and pulls him violently bac against the bars. Garth's gun clatters away down the hall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Fox has heard the shot and is running toward the j

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth, his neck broken, lies crumpled outside Mal's cell. Rae is unconscious and bloodied against the far wall. The large key ring is on the floor under Garth's leg and out Mal's reach. Mal's anguished gaze darts from Rae to the k as he begins to drag the dead weight of Garth's leg towar the bars. The key ring is dragged a few inches, then slip free. Mal tries again, then hears the front door SLAM ope in the outer office. Mal looks at the gun lying useless d the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox draws his gun as he rushes across toward the cellbloc door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth! You in there, Garth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The keys still lie in the middle of the hall, the gun dow at the end. Fox comes through the door, gun raised, and takes in the  sight of the two bodies. He looks up in surprise as Slick dagger flies into his chest with a THUNK. Fox dies. Down the line of bars, Mal's right arm is extended into t corridor, as it was when he released the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden is leaning all the way over the bar to extract a gl from beneath it. He straightens and walks back to the tab where Stella still sits. Now, however, she has drawn her  legs up before her on the chair and is hugging her knees, deep in thought. The saloon is now empty save for these t Paden pours them each a drink and hands Stella's to her.  This brings her back. He clinks his glass with hers and t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To my midnight star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange a long look, then drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb's using me to stop you. So good  people are being hurt because of me. (a beat) That makes me mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listening closely, he finds this last bit endearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people think because they're  stronger -- or meaner -- they can  push you around. I've seen a lot of  that. But it's only true if you let  it be. The world is what you make of  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your attitude. But it can be  risky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a challenge in her eyes as she reaches out and s the whiskey bottle away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't hurt me if he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden looks at her with growing appreciation. A light is  coming back into his face. A smile slowly grows on his li mirroring hers. The door behind the bar bangs open, and Phoebe comes out, breathless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella, come quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoebe leads them into the dimly-lit room and goes to her knees beside Rae, who lies wounded on the floor. Rae is s conscious and moaning. Stella stoops to examine her wound

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) She sprung her brother... all by  herself! And this is what happened...  He brought her here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him about Jake and the little  boy. He went off after Emmett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Phoebe) Stop your crying. Go get Doc Skinner  and bring him to the shed. (to Paden) Pick her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoebe hurries out. Paden kneels next to Stella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a place I can hide her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get in there with her  until this thing is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett works by the light of the fire, checking one of th guns taken from the deputies. He hears something we do no but continues to work for a few moments more. Now we hear it: an approaching rider. Emmett stands up gingerly and m painfully back into the shadows. He is much improved but  still tentative. Mal comes into the cave carrying his Henry rifle. Emmett  reappears, lowering his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think you were going to  make it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal steps into the light, revealing his bruised face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts to Mal's  condition) Where's Jake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick's men got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal indicates that he doesn't know. Emmett accepts that a picks up his gunbelt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's worse than that, Emmett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett looks up, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took him at your sister's house.  Her husband was shot. I don't know  if he's going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett feels real pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was hurt... pretty bad. (hates to tell him) Emmett, they took the little boy  with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett lets this all sink in. And then his face and body  begin to transform. All the pain is swept away in a surgi current of vengeful energy. The MUSIC begins to build, as Emmett moves with eerie deliberateness to arm himself. He picks up one of the extra gunbelts and loops it over his  shoulder. Mal slides into his bandolier. Emmett indicates the gunbe remaining on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want one of these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mal turns. He now holds his father's Henry rifle in addit to his own, one awesome weapon in each hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This oughta do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb, having just finished breakfast, steps out into the  morning light and looks around at his domain. He works th toothpick in his mouth and watches Tyree come slowly up t street on horseback. They nod their greetings and head do the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyree ties his horse in front, and the two men go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb is barely in the door when he stops, noticing someth out of place. The gun cabinet has been forced open; its  splintered door is ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garth! (nothing) Yo, Fox!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyree draws his gun, but Cobb is already moving toward th cellblock door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb and Tyree survey the scene: the empty cell, three po of blood, two bodies -- Garth and Fox. Cobb watches as Ty checks the two deputies and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Kyle and Dusty over here. And  keep your eyes open. I'm running out  of deputies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bartender comes to the head of the stairs wearing a  nightshirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella ain't here, Sheriff. I checked  her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we see Cobb waiting at the bottom of the steps,  thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't know where Paden is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't seen him since last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know if you do. And tell Stella  I want to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb turns and walks to the open, outer doors at the corn of the saloon. The swinging doors are still hooked back f the night. When Cobb stops in the doorway, he casts a lon shadow across the room. He stares out into the town for  several beats, then lifts his gun from its holster and ch the action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The McKendrick brand is fashioned in wood at the peak of arch over the road. Beyond it, in the distance, cattle ar grazing on the rolling land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of cattle are grazing here in the morning light, sea of speckled hides. Now a Cowboy pulls up in the  foreground. He is heavily armed. His watchful gaze is not the cattle, but outward toward the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More Cowboys here, armed and watchful. Red comes along a  corral and climbs up onto a fence to peer into the distan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scruffy, scratching his belly, walks along the porch of t main ranch house, the casa grande. As he comes up to us a the corner and looks around, we see that he is wearing Ja elaborately tooled, double gunbelt with the pearl-handled Colts. As he moves down the other side of the house, we see  McKendrick standing at a window, looking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're behind McKendrick now. On the wall next to the wind there is a large, framed photograph of Murdo McKendrick, big, ferocious man, sitting rather stiffly in a chair. On one side of him stands his wife, as thin and tough as a n On the other, beneath a large, paternal hand, a small boy young Ethan. McKendrick turns away from the window and for an instant eye is stopped by the photograph. McKendrick looks unsett He hasn't slept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augie is huddled on a bed in the corner of the dark room, frightened, still wearing the nightshirt he had on when  abducted. Suddenly, sunlight blinds him. The Watching Cowboy from the night before has thrown open the curtains. He looks out over the roof of the veranda,  then turns back. He gives Augie an odd look and moves tow the door, first kicking a Guard Cowboy awake in his chair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett and Mal ride side by side. Relentless. You wouldn' want to be the people they're going to visit. Now a solitary rider appears on the ridge above them, mov the same way. Mal notices him first, then Emmett. It is P and now he is sloping down to join them. He moves in alongside them. They exchange looks. Then all three look ahead. Where they are going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Skinner has tended Rae on a cot in the dark recess of the shed and now moves with Stella to the door. Phoebe kn beside Rae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If her skin gets cold, you better  come for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella nods, then cracks the door to peek outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT SHE SEES. This shed is down the alley from the back the Midnight Star. The alley is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Skinner comes out and begins to walk away. Slick appe from between two buildings. They nod to each other, and D Skinner walks away. Slick watches him for a moment, then  moves up the alley, looking around as he goes. He walks p the shed and on toward the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick reaches the end of the alley and stops. Cobb comes  down the sidewalk toward him. They talk confidentially. S shakes his head. They part, continuing their separate pro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE CORRAL. One of the horses drinking at the trough l its head, ears twitching. A wave of restlessness goes thr the horses. On the top of the fence, Red notices and begi to listen intently. ON THE VERANDA. Scruffy stands up from a step and looks o toward the rise beyond the corrals. Alarm creeps into his face. AT THE BUNKHOUSE. Swann, his shoulder bandaged, comes out join a Sentry Cowboy looking with concern at the rise.  Suddenly, the Sentry Cowboy starts running toward a saddl horse nearby. Red has jumped from the fence now too and  mounted up quickly. The two horsemen head off toward the  rise at a gallop. Swann looks in alarm at -- THE CREST OF THE RISE. Pouring into view with a ground-sh RUMBLE is a huge herd of stampeding cattle. AT THE BUNKHOUSE. Swann turns to the door of the bunkhous and shouts inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stampede!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE RISE. Red and the Sentry Cowboy tear toward the  oncoming cattle. They fire their guns repeatedly in the a trying to turn the herd. AT THE CORRAL. Scruffy runs across from the casa grande a joins other Cowboys trying to saddle and mount panicked  horses. Scruffy's horse rears and breaks away from him. ON THE RISE. Red and the Sentry Cowboy are closing with t dust-enshrouded herd, still firing their guns. Suddenly,  from the cloud, there are answering shots. The Sentry Cow is shot dead off his horse. Emerging like a spirit from the dust at the edge of the h comes Emmett, six-gun in hand. On the other side of the herd, Paden's form materializes. aims his Winchester and fires. Red's horse rears. Red goe down and the herd pounds over him. AT THE BUNKHOUSE. Hoyt comes out the door, buckling on hi gunbelt. He looks at the on-rushing stampede, then toward the corral where several Cowboys are swinging up on their horses. Suddenly, there is gunfire from the roof of the  bunkhouse above Hoyt. One of the Cowboys in the corral go down. Another draws his gun and lifts it toward the bunkh but is shot before he can fire. The other Cowboys head fo cover. Hoyt stops some men who are coming out the door be him, and edges out to try to locate the source of the fir ON THE VERANDA. McKendrick comes out of the casa grande a runs to the corner of the veranda nearest the rise. He ta in the stampede, which is almost upon them now, then hear gunfire to his right. He looks back there and sees Mal on the bunkhouse roof, above Hoyt and firing from the protec of the raised rim. Now Mal swings his rifle around toward McKendrick. McKendrick jumps around the corner of the hou as the wall where he was standing takes a hit. SERIES OF SHOTS. The stampede hits the ranch. The herd sp the mass of cattle heading between the casa grande and th bunkhouse/corral area; the rest go around behind the casa grande. They take down everything in their way. Fences fa holding pens are destroyed, horses run free, and Cowboys  scramble away from the deadly current of rampaging cattle NEAR THE BARN. Paden pulls up on the edge of the flow and fires repeatedly at the Cowboys scrambling for safety. Sw is among those hit. BEHIND THE CASA GRANDE. Emmett pulls his horse out of the flow, protected by the building, then dismounts, ties the horse, and runs up to the back door of the house. He thro away the empty, extra six-gun in his hand as he looks  carefully inside. He draws his own gun and goes in. NEAR THE BARN. Paden is coming under increasing fire from the bunkhouse as the cattle thin. He rides into the barn the end of the corral. AT THE BUNKHOUSE. Hoyt directs some of his men, including Scruffy, to work their way along under the eaves of the  bunkhouse and go after Paden. Hoyt glances upward toward sound of Mal's rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett works his way carefully down the central hall, gun ready. He looks up the main staircase, sees nothing, and  edges forward. At the top of the stairs behind him, the  Watching Cowboy jumps into view. Emmett spins and ducks a the Watching Cowboy fires. The finial splinters. Emmett's shot follows immediately. The Watching Cowboy is hit and  tumbles the full length of the stairs, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE VERANDA. McKendrick reacts to the shots behind him his house. He moves toward a window and opens it. ON THE BUNKHOUSE ROOF. Mal switches to his father's Henry and shifts around to fire at some outriding Cowboys who a thundering in from the range. AT THE BARN. Three cowboys dive through the main door in  pursuit of Paden. Scruffy, one of Jake's pearl-handled Co at the ready, sneaks along the side of the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett moves away from the stairwell and cautiously round corner, focused on an open bedroom door up ahead. Suddenl the Guard Cowboy steps boldly into view in that doorway, raised, using Augie as a shield. Emmett cannot fire. He d back around the corner as the Guard Cowboy gets off a sho Seeing his miss, the Guard Cowboy slams closed the bedroo door and locks it. Instantly Emmett is running that way. He flies into the  bedroom next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard Cowboy has backed against the wall, gun raised  toward the door. Augie is still clutched to his chest. The window overlooking the roof of the veranda implodes a Emmett arrives in a shower of glass. The stunned Guard Co spins, opening an angle between himself and Augie. Emmett doesn't need much. He fires before he stops rolling. The  Guard Cowboy falls back against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick, gun poised, stands over the body of the Watch Cowboy, reacting to the shots above. He is about to go up there when the front door crashes open as a Cowboy, shot Mal, staggers into the hall. He leans against the hall ta and fires out the door. Two more shots from Mal finish th Cowboy and a large vase. McKendrick changes him mind about going upstairs. He move quickly toward the door at the back of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augie is trembling in Emmett's arms. Emmett soothes him,  then looks into his tear-stained face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augie, where's Jake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chokes it out) He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett reacts to this hard news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hung him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly a peculiar twinkle grows in Emmett's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hung him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE BUNKHOUSE. Hoyt is hugging the side wall of the  bunkhouse. He warily looks around the back corner. WHAT HE SEES. Mal's horse is tethered near a stack of cra and barrels that rises almost to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden is in an empty stall part-way down one side of the  barn. The three Cowboys have him pinned down from the fro Paden's horse does a panicky dance in the central aisle. horses in the other stalls are spooked. Scruffy sneaks in the back door of the barn. He peeks aro the wall of a stall at Paden's unprotected back. When he  sees Paden stop to reload his Colt, Scruffy steps out and aims at him. Quite unexpectedly, someone swings down from the loft abo kicking Scruffy and sending him flying into the recess of stall. Now the figure drops into view. It's Jake! He dive after Scruffy. Paden, reloaded now and unaware of the struggle behind hi has to shrink back from a splintering rail. Now he hears muffled shots from the back of the barn. He looks over th After a beat, Jake steps into Paden's view, grinning like maniac and happily buckling his reacquired gunbelt. Paden does a double take. Jake gives him a big "Here I am!" ges then indicates he's going up to the loft again to help ou with the guys up front. But first, with real relish, he c his pearl-handled Colts: he draws both at once, tips them to look into the cylinders, then spins them back into the holsters. Then, with a leap, to the loft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick rides flat out toward town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are Cowboys in the first stalls on each side of the barn, and a third in a stall closer to Paden. Jake drops  down from the loft behind the first two, his guns in his  holsters. They both see him and react. Jake draws both gu and shoots one, spins, and shoots the other. The third Cowboy turns to look. His mistake. Paden flies  into view and shoots him dead. Paden approaches Jake with wonder. Jake shows him an ugly bruise where the rope was around his neck. When he speaks it is in a hoarse whisper --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps him on the  back) Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden catches his horse and swings up. Jake pulls a horse from a stall. It is the much-contested pinto, bare-backed but bridled. Paden rides out the back of the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK OF THE BARN. Paden rides out, but pulls up when he  notices that Jake is not following. He is about to go bac when something catches his eye. WHAT HE SEES. Hoyt is just climbing onto the roof of the  bunkhouse, catty-corner from Mal's position. Paden squeezes off a shot, but Hoyt has already disappear from view. Paden looks along the bunkhouse, where he can Mal firing. Mal is protected at present from Hoyt by the chimney he is braced against. But if he isn't warned, Hoy will surprise him. A Cowboy in the bunkhouse spots Paden fires at him. Paden must warn Mal quickly. Yelling is hop in the din. Paden aims carefully at Mal and fires. AT MAL. The chimney is hit just above Mal's head. He swin his rifle around toward -- Paden! Paden signals wildly ab Hoyt. Mal understands just in time: he flops around the  chimney just as Hoyt gets a bead on him. Without knowing Mal avenges his father's murder. Hoyt is blown off the ro The bulk of the herd has passed, but confused cattle are  everywhere. AT THE VERANDA. Jake has ridden across the open area unde heavy fire and now rides for protection up and onto the s veranda of the house, firing into all the windows. His  momentum carries him all the way out the other end. When is beyond the porch, he hears a yell, two voices --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks up with a grin. Emmett has Augie out on the ro of the veranda. They are pleased in the extreme at the si of Jake. Jake brings his horse beneath them and gestures Augie. Augie swallows hard once, strides twice, and leaps out, d and onto the bare back of the pinto behind Jake. Paden comes riding up with Emmett's horse in tow. Emmett  moves to the edge of the veranda roof and drops into his  saddle. He winces, his ribs throbbing. They turn their ho away from the ranch and head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three horses with four riders come tearing toward us. They form a dusty "V" as they intersect with Mal's arriva from the other side of the bunkhouse. Even now, shots are fired after them. But they are on their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHOPKEEPER is placing items in his front window when eye is caught by something across the street. We can see  only a dim reflection of it in the glass. With a concerne look, the Shopkeeper comes outside. WHAT HE SEES. Trouble. Five men, loaded for bear, are com out of Cobb's office: Cobb, McKendrick, Tyree, Kyle, and  DUSTY, another deputy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty mounts up and rides toward the center of town. Kyle goes off in another direction on foot. McKendrick unhitch his horse and speaks to Cobb with some bitterness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It never should've got this far,  Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb eyes him coolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is as far as it's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick swings up and jacks a cartridge into the chamb of his Winchester. He's not as confident as Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do my part. But you better watch  your ass. These guys'll shoot it  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads off in the same direction as Dusty. Tyree moves next to Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna enjoy this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb gives him a sideways glance, then looks around wistf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This used to be a peaceful town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyree moves off in yet a new direction. The Shopkeeper  approaches Cobb nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, Sheriff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hide and watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shopkeeper reacts big and scurries away to spread the word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty pulls up at the hotel on the corner and throws his  reins over the post. Then, with rifle in hand, he stands his saddle and climbs to the roof of the porch. He looks  down the street, cocks his rifle, and settles into hiding behind the hotel sign. McKendrick rides by slowly, exchanging looks with Dusty, moves down the street. Several townspeople have seen Dusty. The panicky, street- clearing word spreads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae writhes in pain on the cot. Stella's hand is on Rae's forehead as she speaks to Phoebe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better bring the doc. (as Phoebe turns) Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Milliner is urgently closing the shutters on his shop passersby hurry for home. Phoebe edges out of the alley  nearby, turns, and finds herself face to face with Tyree. regards her malevolently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared) Nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no time to be on the streets.  Maybe you oughta come along with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grasps her arm hard and pulls her along the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four horsemen and the boy pull up near the cemetery a look down at Silverado. Jake lowers Augie to the ground.  Emmett hands him a blanket and speaks down to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here till we get back. Don't  come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four riders look from the town to each other and chec their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to them all) I'll see you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Last one to the Midnight Star buys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on! Let's get 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake kicks the bare-back into motion and tears off direct toward town. Emmett heads off to the left. Paden begins t move after Jake, but slower. Mal stops him with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Paden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden nods it back to him, and the bond is re-formed. Mal heads off at a gallop to the right. They are all going to enter town from different directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rae MOANS loudly, and Stella instinctively reaches out to quiet her, worried about discovery. Stella throws a frust glance toward the door -- where is Phoebe? She can't wait. She goes to the door and peeks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick checks Rae's room and closes the door. He too is  frustrated. Now he looks out the hall window, down at the alley. WHAT HE SEES. Stella steps quickly out of the storage she and moves away. Slick runs for the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick runs past the shed door and peers between buildings search of Stella. She's gone. He comes back to the shed.  Before opening the door he does an odd thing: he chops hi left forearm sharply downward and a shiny derringer slide crisply into his grip from beneath his sleeve. He enters  cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick moves through the dim light. He hears a MOAN and st forward. He looks down at Rae. Half-delirious, she focuse on him and reacts in terror. He makes the derringer disap and kneels beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid, baby. I'll stay  with you until your little friend  comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake comes riding down the street, waving his hat, WHOOPI and HOLLERING. The few remaining pedestrians run for cove at the sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Come on out, boys! Jake's in town!  Let's start the ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake jumps off the pinto and hitches it in front of the  saloon. As he approaches the entrance, set in the cut-off corner of the building, he executes a fast pirouette, sca down all four blocks that meet here. He finds the doors l and kicks them open with a loud BANG. He goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyree has heard the commotion and moves toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella is pounding on the door without luck. She gives up looks around, and hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyree stops across the street from the Midnight Star and  looks at Jake's horse and the open doors. Across the  intersection Kyle appears at a run. Tyree motions him to around the back of the saloon. Tyree runs across the stre When he is on the porch of the saloon, he pulls his gun a begins edging toward the open doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark in here with the shutters closed. Tyree jumps  inside, gun poised. When Kyle bangs through from the back Tyree almost shoots him. They scan the room and advance  cautiously into the shadows. Nobody here. Now they back o eyeing the dark stairwell. When they are safely on the porch, Tyree motions for Kyle go down one side of the building while he starts down the other. Jake appears from beneath Stella's ramp behind the bar an vaults lightly over the bar. In a moment he stands just i the open doorway. He peeks out, then turns so his back is the outside, his guns still holstered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake backs quietly out onto the porch. When he stops, he see both Tyree and Kyle moving along their respective por

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyree and Kyle spin at the sound. Only then does Jake dra both guns and, pointing them in two completely different  directions, he shoots both men at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slick has made himself comfortable next to Rae, who has f into a fitful sleep. Now he hears something. The door of shed opens and closes. He waits confidently for Stella to appear around the intervening wall of barrels and crates. But he's looking too low. Mal steps into view, the big He rifle in his hand. Slick's eyes widen, but he gets contro quickly and rises, trying to gauge Mal's attitude. Mal looks from Rae to Slick and back to Rae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you're here, Mal. I've been  watching her, but she needs a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Slick as he leans his rifle against the wall. Slick looks at the rifle, then at Mal. Mal seems to  concentrate on Rae and makes a move that way. When he is  past Slick, Slick makes the peculiar, chopping gesture of his left forearm that snaps the derringer into his hand. Mal has been waiting for something and is already turning into Slick. Before Slick can raise his gun hand, Mal has  Slick's wrist in a vise-like grip. Mal's other arm encirc Slick's torso and crushes him against Mal's body. Two str men strain against each other. The cocked derringer wavers perilously toward the sleepin Rae. Suddenly, Mal twists Slick around, banging his hand  into the wall, and the derringer fires. Slick lets it cla to the floor. Rae wakes with a start and watches the combatants in terr The men's eyes are only inches apart. Something flashes  through Mal's and he loosens his embrace. Instantly, Slic dips to the right, lifting his boot to his hand. But his  dagger is not there. Slick's surprised look is answered by Mal's tight grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their bodies jerk as Slick gets his last surprise and goe limp in Mal's arms. He falls to the floor, his own boot d protruding from his ribcage. Mal kneels to embrace his sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett rides slowly down the street, his Winchester held  ready on his thigh. His eyes continually scan the buildin and alleyways. He slowly rounds a corner. Way behind him, off his right shoulder, McKendrick has br his horse to a stop between two buildings and is carefull aiming at Emmett's back with his Winchester. Now he pulls the hammer back with a CLICK. Emmett hears it and twists in the saddle as McKendrick fi The shot is good, but Emmett's Winchester takes the hit a jumps in his hand. He levels it at McKendrick, cocks the  hammer, and squeezes the trigger. Nothing. He tries to wo the lever as McKendrick fires again. Emmett's rifle is  useless. He throws it away and draws his Colt, firing twi Emmett's bullets hit close to McKendrick. His horse shies McKendrick turns his horse and rides behind a building. SERIES OF SHOTS. Emmett chases after McKendrick along a  parallel street. Each man prepares to fire as they reach intermittent spaces between buildings. McKendrick gets a  clear shot and fires twice. Emmett rides around a buildin and speeds toward McKendrick's path. He comes into the op ready to fire, but McKendrick is heading off down an alle Rather than follow, Emmett moves to cut him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick has pulled up behind a barn. When Emmett comes into view, McKendrick fires twice, then spurs his horse b into town. Emmett squeezes off one carefully aimed shot,  just missing McKendrick before he disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The echoes of gunfire reach the little boy waiting at the cemetery. Augie watches and wonders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKendrick comes out of an alley and tears toward the  intersection which Dusty commands from the roof of the ho porch. McKendrick waves his rifle at Dusty and rounds the corner of the hotel. Now Emmett comes out of the alley in pursuit. He slows a since McKendrick is no longer in sight. As he moves down block toward the hotel intersection, he looks into the lo yard of the feed warehouse, which forms a cul-de-sac on h left. Now Dusty opens fire from the protection of the hotel sig Bullets kick up dirt around Emmett, but instead of retrea he slings himself Indian-fashion down along the protected side of his horse, and rides toward the sign. Emmett aims over the mane and fires: once, twice, through the sign. Dusty rises, hit, and Emmett kills him with a t shot. Dusty crashes through the sign to fall to the stree Emmett has just straightened in his saddle and snapped op the loading gate of his empty Colt, when McKendrick opens from where he has reappeared down the street. Emmett is h in the thigh. For one long second there is perfect clarity between the  men. Emmett's eyes stare from his pain-contorted countena at his adversary. McKendrick hesitates only a breath to l at Emmett before raising the rifle and charging. Emmett wheels his horse and painfully spurs it back down block. As McKendrick's fire hits around him, Emmett turns into the nearest cover -- the loading yard of the feed  warehouse. McKendrick rides toward the mouth of the loading yard wit all he's got. He can't let Emmett reload. The glint of vi is in his eyes as he draws near the loading yard. He raises his rifle in preparation for the coming clear s at his trapped enemy. As his horse begins to pass in fron of the loading yard, we hear a terrible RUMBLE OF HOOFBEA on wood. McKendrick's expression changes to horror. Emmett has ridden onto the loading dock of the warehouse charged toward this end. Now he jumps his horse straight into the air over McKendrick's horse. The hooves of Emmet horse catch McKendrick full force with a HORRIBLE SOUND. Emmett's horse lands on its feet, but just barely. From a cloud of dust Emmett watches McKendrick's horse race on,  riderless. Its master is a still shape in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella has been hurrying through the empty streets. Now s pauses to listen to the new silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cobb listens too. He sits on the steps at the front of hi office, toying with an object in his hands. Now he brings to his mouth. It is his sheriff's badge, and he breathes fog onto it, then polishes it on his sleeve. He looks at another moment, smiles to himself, then pins it on his ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden is walking. He is calm. He rounds a corner and move out into the center of the new street. AT THE END OF THE STREET. Cobb looks up from his seat and sees Paden coming toward him. He had a feeling it would b this way. It makes him sad. He stands up and walks to the center of the street. Paden keeps coming. He watches Cobb, resigned. Now Paden  stops. Stella comes out of an alley. When she takes in the scene she steps onto the sidewalk and puts her hand on a post. looks back and forth between the men. Cobb sees her, but his only real concern is Paden. Paden  sees her, too. His gaze returns to Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a waste. This could have been  such a sweet deal for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Bad luck. (a beat) Good-bye, Cobb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Paden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both draw, and it's impossible to say who moved firs But one is luckier. Paden stands as Cobb falls. Paden holsters his gun as though it weighed a hundred pou CUT TO BLACK. SLOW FADE-UP over the SOUNDS of tinkling glasses, piano m and friendly voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four shot glasses sparkle in a line on the bar. A bottle the good stuff is used to fill them. Stella is pouring the drinks from behind the bar. Now the glasses are lifted by Mal, Jake, Paden, and Emmett. Stell holds up the bottle and proposes a toast --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To California!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They echo her and clink glasses. Stella clinks with the  bottle. When they toss back their drinks, she tips the bo to her lips, then puts it down on the bar, as the four gl come down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four men move toward the door as Stella walks down he ramp. Emmett walks with a slight limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoebe stands on the porch talking across to Rae, much  recovered, who sits on the seat of a wagon heavily loaded with farming supplies. Rae wears a simple dress and looks quite different. The men come out onto the porch. Emmett shakes Mal's hand and watches him climb onto the wagon. Mal gets the wagon  going, and the other wave. Jake has slipped his arm around Phoebe's waist. Now he tu her into his arms for a big kiss. Emmett is watching Mal and Rae roll away when a woman's h touches his back. He turns to find Hannah looking up at h Paden watches from nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weren't you going to come out to say  good-bye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time you're really going? (he nods) You know where I'll be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other. She kisses him and steps back. W Emmett looks up from her, Paden is watching him with an a look. The two men shake hands. Emmett and Jake mount up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, Paden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paden gives him a nod. Kate and Augie roll up in a buggy. the back seat, a blanket across his legs, sits J.T. They  wait for the brothers. Augie drives for his recovering mo Stella comes out and stands by Phoebe. Hannah is now standing next to Paden. Emmett looks at the as though they were a couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Paden) You might make a farmer yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arm against the post, and his coat is drawn b to reveal the shiny sheriff's badge on his vest. Emmett touches the brim of his hat and turns his horse aw He and Jake flank the buggy and head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett and Jake take turns leaning down from their saddle to kiss Kate and Augie and shake hands with J.T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Augie) Take care of your folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One final look, and they're off. Jake turns in the saddle only once --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spur their horses forward, chasing their shadows, he west.
